books.name: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A novel about the decadence and excess of the Jazz Age, set in the Roaring Twenties.

books.name: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A novel about a young girl growing up in the Deep South during the 1930s, and about the crisis of civil rights in the South following the Civil Rights Act of 1957.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where government surveillance and propaganda are omnipresent.

books.name: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A novel about a young boy growing up in the Deep South during the 1930s, and about the crisis of civil rights in the South following the Civil Rights Act of 1957.

books.name: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A trilogy of epic fantasy novels about the quest for the Hobbit and the Lord of the Rings.

books.name: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A children's fantasy novel about a hobbit who is recruited by a wizard to help a group of dwarves reclaim their treasure from a dragon.

books.name: The Da Vinci Code
books.author: Dan Brown
books.description: A novel about a secret government agency that helps to decipher ancient Egyptian hieroglyphs.

books.name: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A novel about the decadence and excess of the Jazz Age, set in the Roaring Twenties.

books.name: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A novel about a young girl growing up in the Deep South during the 1930s, and about the crisis of civil rights in the South following the Civil Rights Act of 1957.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where government surveillance and propaganda are omnipresent.

books.name: The Hunger Games
books.author: Suzanne Collins
books.description: The Hunger Games is a novel by Suzanne Collins about a teenager who is sent to fight in a game of survival known as the Hunger Games, where she must outsmart her pursuers and survive the rigors of the game. The novel explores themes of survival, identity, and the human condition.

books.name: The Fault in Our Stars
books.author: Ernest Hemingway
books.description: The Fault in Our Stars is a novel by Ernest Hemingway about a young woman who is wrongfully accused of murdering her sister, and her efforts to clear her name. The novel explores themes of love, guilt, and the human condition.

books.name: The Giver
books.author: Toni Morrison
books.description: The Giver is a novel by Toni Morrison about a young woman who is falsely accused of abuse by her boyfriend, and her efforts to clear her name. The novel explores themes of love, guilt, and the human condition.

books.name: The Alchemist
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.description: The Alchemist is a novel by Paulo Coelho about a young boy who is accidentally transported to the past, and his struggle to find his way back to the present. The novel explores themes of time travel, identity, and the human condition.

books.name: The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe is a novel by J.K. Rowling about a young girl who is cursed to wear a witch's hat and wield a lion's sword, and her bravery and determination to break free from her spell.

books.name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
books.author: Francis Ford Coppola
books.description: The Picture of Dorian Gray is a novel by Francis Ford Coppola about a young man who is falsely accused of murdering his wife, and his efforts to clear his name. The novel explores themes of love, guilt, and the human condition.

books.name: The Name of the Rose
books.author: Ernest Hemingway
books.description: The Name of the Rose is a novel by Ernest Hemingway about a young woman who is falsely accused of murdering her husband, and her efforts to clear her name. The novel explores themes of love, guilt, and the human condition.
